c: bootstrap-claude.sh preserves all non-YOLO non-GSD sections verbatim
ev: BEFORE_FIRST_SECTION=true + IN_MANAGED_SECTION flag correctly filters non-YOLO content into NON_YOLO_CONTENT; test 5 (preserves non-YOLO sections) passes; test 13 (code block content preserved) passes; all 17 bats tests pass

c: YOLO_SECTIONS array matches all sections generated by generate_yolo_sections()
ev: bootstrap-claude.sh lines 38-47 has 8 sections; verify_section_registry() called unconditionally at line 179 compares sorted arrays; test 16 (--verify exits 0) passes; test 17 (fresh file has exactly 8 YOLO sections) passes

c: Content between top-level heading and first section header is not duplicated
ev: BEFORE_FIRST_SECTION=true flag at line 230, cleared on first ## detection at lines 249 and 256; test 11 (content between heading and first ## not duplicated) passes

c: go.md ship mode step 8 calls bootstrap-claude.sh instead of inline regeneration
ev: go.md line 411: 'Regenerate CLAUDE.md via bootstrap-claude.sh:' with explicit bash call; grep confirms 2 occurrences of bootstrap-claude.sh (B6 line 179 + step 8 line 411); 'Preserve non-YOLO content' prose absent from go.md

c: scripts/bootstrap/bootstrap-claude.sh artifact exists with Department Architecture
ev: File exists at scripts/bootstrap/bootstrap-claude.sh (10.5K); grep finds 'Department Architecture' at lines 40 (YOLO_SECTIONS array) and 73 (generate_yolo_sections output)

c: tests/unit/bootstrap/bootstrap-claude.bats test file exists with preservation tests
ev: File exists at tests/unit/bootstrap/bootstrap-claude.bats (8.6K); bats run: 17/17 tests pass including test 9 (Department Architecture), test 10 (no duplication), test 11 (heading content not duplicated), test 12 (in-place regen)

c: go.md ship mode references bootstrap-claude.sh for CLAUDE.md regeneration (kl)
ev: go.md line 179 (B6) and line 411 (step 8) both reference bootstrap-claude.sh; grep returns 2 matches

c: Plan header p field contains phase number only (e.g. '01' not '01-01')
ev: 01-01.plan.jsonl header: p='01'; 01-02.plan.jsonl header: p='01'; 01-03.plan.jsonl header: p='01'; all use canonical format

c: Plan header n field contains plan number only (e.g. '01' not plan title)
ev: 01-01.plan.jsonl header: n='01'; 01-02.plan.jsonl header: n='02'; 01-03.plan.jsonl header: n='03'; all use zero-padded number strings

c: Task lines use canonical keys: id, tp, a, f, v, done
ev: All task lines in 01-01, 01-02, 01-03 plans verified to have id, tp, a, f, v, done keys; validate-naming.sh confirms on canonical plans

c: Summary lines use canonical keys per artifact-formats.md
ev: validate-naming.sh validate_summary_naming checks 12 required keys: p n t s dt tc tt ch fm dv built tst; legacy key detection for commits/tasks/dev/sum; test 11 (valid summary) and tests 12-18 pass

c: references/naming-conventions.md exists with canonical patterns
ev: File exists at references/naming-conventions.md (9.6K, 237 lines under 300 limit); 9 sections covering file naming, plan headers, task keys, summaries, reqs, other artifacts, cross-department, state, anti-patterns

c: naming-conventions.md references artifact-formats.md as normative source (kl)
ev: naming-conventions.md line 3: 'Normative key definitions are in artifact-formats.md'; sections 2-6 each reference artifact-formats.md line numbers

c: decisions.jsonl contains naming audit findings
ev: decisions.jsonl has 34 lines with entries including root cause investigations (T1), naming audit findings covering 3 milestones, reqs.jsonl audit findings

c: validate-naming.sh catches p field with compound IDs
ev: validate-naming.sh line 97-99: [[ p_val == *-* ]] triggers add_error 'compound'; test 2 passes; live test confirms exit 1 with error 'Header p field is compound 01-01'

c: validate-naming.sh catches n field with title strings
ev: validate-naming.sh line 108-110: ! [[ n_val =~ ^[0-9]{2}$ ]] triggers add_error 'not a plan number'; test 3 passes; live test confirms 'Header n field Some Title is not a plan number'

c: validate-naming.sh catches task lines missing tp field
ev: validate-naming.sh line 172: required_keys includes 'tp' for non-turbo plans; test 5 passes; live test confirms 'Task T1: missing required key: tp'

c: validate-naming.sh catches summary files using legacy keys
ev: validate-naming.sh lines 240-251 check for commits/tasks/dev/sum and add_error; tests 12-14 (legacy commits/tasks/dev) all pass

c: validate-naming.sh exits non-zero on any naming violation
ev: validate-naming.sh line 474-475: exit 1 when ERRORS non-empty; live test exit code = 1 on compound p field; all validate-naming test failures confirm exit 1

c: scripts/validate-naming.sh artifact exists, executable, validates plan and summary naming
ev: File exists at scripts/validate-naming.sh (14.3K); bats run: 26/26 tests pass; script validates plans (tests 1-10), summaries (tests 11-18), reqs (tests 19-20), directory mode (tests 21-23), drift detection (test 24)
